DOC.HEAD: Multimedia Communications Company Names President
DOC.TEXT: James T. Lynagh, president of Multimedia Broadcasting Co., has been elected president and chief operating officer of its parent company, Multimedia Inc. Lynagh takes over the office from Walter E. Bartlett, who was recently elected chairman and chief executive of Multimedia Inc., company officials said in a release issued Monday. He joined the company as president of Multimedia Broadcasting in 1981. He was elected senior vice president of Multimedia Inc. in 1987 and a member of the board of directors in 1988. William L. Bolster will succeed Lynagh as head of Multimedia Broadcasting, and was also elected a vice president of Multimedia Inc. Bolster was vice president and general manager of Multimedia's St. Louis television station, KSDK. Both executives assume their new offices immediately. Multimedia Inc., is a diversified media communications company which publishes 14 daily and 43 non-daily newspapers; owns and operates four television and seven radio stations; operates more than 100 cable franchises in four states; and produces and syndicates the Phil Donahue and Sally Jessy Raphael shows.
